titleStmt.title: Thomas G. Slater et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5689

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: we the undersigned citizens of Louisville Kentucky know the characters of Dona Harris Mary Jane McCord & John Gavin witnesses for the commonwealth against John Welch charged with the murder of Mrs Allen Gavin.
We state that the two first named are the lowest order of Prostitutes & at the time of the killing were denizens of an alley.
The witness Gavin was also a resident of said alley, & in the same house with Dona Harris & Mary Jane Mc Cord, & said House was a house of prostitution

Thomas. G. Slater
J. H. Price
Thomas. Antle
Joel Sambourne
Subscribed and sworn to before me Phil Tomppert Jr Clerk of the City Court of Louisville by Thos G. Slater, J. H. Price and Thos Antle this 12th day of July 1864
attest Phil Tomppert Jr C C C L
